Package com.example.hive.Controllers

Class FirebaseController

java.lang.Object
com.example.hive.Controllers.FirebaseController
Direct Known Subclasses:
EventController, FacilityController, ImageController, ListController
public class FirebaseController extends Object
A singleton class that creates an instance of the Firestore database

    • getDb

      public com.google.firebase.firestore.FirebaseFirestore getDb()
      this gets the database if it has been initialized otherwise it initializes it so that db is not null.
      Returns:
      the database

    • checkUserByDeviceId

      public CompletableFuture<Boolean> checkUserByDeviceId(String deviceId)
      Check if a user exists in db based on the device id completable future is async programming thus multiple ops can run concurrently w/o blocking each other or having to wait for tasks in the queue to finish first
      Parameters:
      deviceId - assume one per user
      Returns:
      boolean to indicate true if deviceId is found else false

    • checkUserByEmail

      public CompletableFuture<Boolean> checkUserByEmail(String email)
      Check if a user exists in db based on the email completable future is async programming thus multiple ops can run concurrently w/o blocking each other or having to wait for tasks in the queue to finish first
      Parameters:
      email - email; assume one per user
      Returns:
      boolean to indicate true if email is found else false

    • addUser

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> addUser(String deviceId, String userName, String email, String role, List<String> roleSet, @Nullable String phoneNumber, @Nullable String profileImageUrl)
      Add new user to db with their: deviceId, userName, role set can also update user information On success and on failure listeners to log errors.
      Parameters:
      deviceId - device id
      userName - user name (not for sign-in but for profile info)
      email - user email requested as first time user
      roleSet - role (one of entrant, organizer, admin)
      phoneNumber - optional, can be null
      Returns:
      Task note: successful return indicates that addUser was successful.

    • fetchAllUsers

      public CompletableFuture<List<User>> fetchAllUsers()
      Fetch all users from db
      Returns:
      CompletableFuture<List<Users>> aka a list of users (in the future, when the operation is complete)

      listener -

    • addUserToWaitingList

      public void addUserToWaitingList(String waitingListId, String userId, FirebaseController.Callback callback)
      Adds a user to the waiting list of a specific event in Firestore.
      Parameters:
      waitingListId - The ID of the waiting list to which the user should be added.
      userId - The ID of the user to be added.
      callback - A callback to handle success or failure of the operation.

    • removeUserFromWaitingListWithLocation

      public void removeUserFromWaitingListWithLocation(String waitingListId, String userId, FirebaseController.Callback callback)

    • removeUserFromWaitingList

      public void removeUserFromWaitingList(String waitingListId, String userId, FirebaseController.Callback callback)
      Removes a user from the waiting list of a specific event in Firestore.
      Parameters:
      waitingListId - The ID of the waiting list from which the user should be removed.
      userId - The ID of the user to be removed.
      callback - A callback to handle success or failure of the operation.
